intro: Linosyris howardii var. nevadensis, commonly known as the Nevada linosyris, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. It thrives in sandy or gravelly soils and is often found in open, sunny habitats such as disturbed areas and dry slopes. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endemic species within its range.
